reviews.text: We had driven from Estes Park and debated whether to stay in Grand Lake or Dillon. So glad we chose the Best Western Ptarmigan at Dillon because it turned out to be the best hotel we stayed at during a week-long trip in Colorado. Unlike several Grand Lake hotels that are pricier or did not include breakfast or are not that close to the lake, the Best Western Ptarmigan has very good off-season rates, includes breakfast and is in a great location right by Dillon lake in a nice area of town. The grounds are nicely landscaped and the lake view is beautiful and peaceful. The room is clean and tastefully decorated, and the bathroom is nice and spacious. There was a refrigerator and microwave in the room. For dinner we dined at the Arapahoe Cafe and Pub next door (check for nightly specials served in the downstairs pub). The hotel served a hot breakfast in the morning with scrambled eggs & sausage, hard-boiled eggs, waffles as well as pastries, cereal, juices and fruit. After breakfast we took a stroll along the lake. The whole experience was so nice we wished we could stay another night! Would definitely stay here again if we are ever in the area.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

reviews.text: I drove to Dillon with no hotel reservation and this was the only hotel I could find by the lake. I am so glad I did. The woman at the reception desk was wonderful as were the rest of the staff. It was very quiet at night. The view from the second floor balcony is unbelievable. The rooms are older, but very comfortable. There is no fridge though, but that was okay. The breakfast was nice too, just enough to start your day. I love it there, and plan to stay there again when my family is in town.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great staff, beautiful view!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ( It reminded me a little of Lake Bled in Slovenia)
reviews.title: Gorgeous Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with friend & 2 pets for 2 nights, it was so beautiful with the aspens changing colors at their beautiful peaks, we called on the way out of town and booked another night! The only complaint I have (not the hotel's fault but could have advised us, possibly moved us to another room) was that there was some sort of "car testing" going on in the parking lot ALL night long outside our room, starting up of engines, loud talking and this kept our pets barking and kept us up as well. The front desk advised we should have called them, rightfully so however very disruptive. After they all check out the next day, our stay was restful and relaxing. Complimentary breakfast was great, go early cuz it gets really busy in a small area. Hot and cold items, nice selection. Beautiful reservoir only a few steps away and a morning view that will take your breath away. Will definitely stay here again and soon!
reviews.title: Right across from a beautiful lake

reviews.text: Adequate sized room,very clean, and comfortable beds. Some noise from the ice machine outside of room. Beautiful location by the lake, large hot tub. would recommend and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great deal and good location for hiking and kayaking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the two bedroom suite above the lobby. Really roomy, nice deck, spacious bathroom, full kitchen. Staff was helpful, free breakfast was pretty complete, with eggs, sausage, etc. We travel with a pet and that was no problem. Looking forward to going back!
reviews.title: Excellent stay, really enjoyed it!

reviews.text: Perfect for what we were looking for - clean, well-located, affordable. Went for spring break skiing with my teenage daughter and were wowed by the location right on Lake Dillon. Pretty setting, perfectly comfortable room, beds with lots of fluffy pillows, even a little fridge which came in handy to keep those beers cold. Centrally located to all Summit ski areas. Skied Breck the first day (15 minutes), then Keystone (10 minutes), then Vail (25 minutes). In-room WiFi for free and no problem. Breakfast perfectly wonderful and a hearty start to the activities of the day. We felt welcome, and loved the homey feel. We would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice, Clean and a Bargain

reviews.text: Stayed here while skiing at Copper Mountain. Drive to Copper was only about 10-12 minutes. This hotel was conveniently located, close to shops, restaurants, etc. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. There was a continental breakfast with eggs and sausage that was fresh and well stocked. Great option if you're skiing nearby and want to keep your costs down. It wasn't the cheapest hotel in the area, but it was definitely on the low side. Very scenic being right on Lake Dillon.
reviews.title: Good hotel for a good price
Love it!
reviews.text: This hotel is the best place to stay....right by the lake and close to everything. I take my dog and they love dogs. They also have rooms with kitchenette which is cool if you stay a few days and don't always want to eat out. Great any time ...year round! I stayed there over 20 times I think an always love it. The prices are also great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because my wife and I didn't want to drive too far after skiing at Keystone for the day, we booked a room at Best Western in Dillon. Honestly, when we checked in, it was kind of dark already (let alone that the window was facing the opposite), so we didn't see the lake.
reviews.title: Good place to stay before/after Keystone Ski Trips

reviews.text: The Best Western Ptarmigan Lodge in Dillon, CO is located in a WONDERFUL spot on the North shore of beautiful Dillon Resvr. The staff of this hotel are absolutely superb! And, that high compliment goes for the staff who manage the phones and the desk, those who provide the full hot breakfast each morning, the effient and friendly staff who maintain and clean the rooms and the General Manager as well. All are courteous, friendly and, best of all, they KNOW THE AREA in and around Dillon. Their drivng, shopping, entertainment and dining all proved to be both current and accuate.
reviews.title: "Rocky Moutain High!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those unfamiliar with Dillon, it is less than a hundred miles from the Denver airport so driving up from Denver provides both a beautiful and relaxing break from big city traffic. Just past the Eisnehower tunnel, Dillon is over 7,000 feet in elevation and it surrounded by several top-ranked ski resorts such as Breckenridge, Copper Mt. and Keystone. In summer, a full range of outdoor activies is available including Blue Ribbon Trout Fishing, Sailing, moutain touring, golf, tennis, swimming, etc.
reviews.title: A GREAT place to stay in Dillon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ptarmigan Lodge itself is in an ideal location with five separate buildings offering lodging. We recommend one of the upstairs rooms several of which include small balconies with magnificient views. We were so impressed by the BWPL that we actually changed our itinerary and returned from Aspen to spend a second night there. For a clean, reasonably priced hotel location in a stunning setting with OUTSTANDING hotel staff, my wife and I highly recommend the BWPL!!! --- Mountain Man Dan.
reviews.title: Superclean hotel in a beautiful location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located on Lake Dillon (recently named by MSN as one of the 8 best lake destinations in the country), the property is a little dated but still an excellent place to stay... clean and well maintained. We were there for almost a week and very much enjoyed our stay. It is in a beautiful location nestled in the Rocky Mountains, our balconey overlooked the lake with the mountains in the background (see the picture). The complimentary breakfast is hot and always kept well stocked, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the location is close to almost anything a visitor would like to do in the Dillon, Breckenridge, Vail, Leadville, Aspen area. In short it is a great place stay while visiting central Colorado. The Arapaho Cafe next to the hotel is an excellent place to eat with great food at very reasonable prices. Note: while there is no air conditioning at this hotel, we were there during the warmest time of the year and found we were quite comfortable without it .
reviews.title: Wonderful stay and a view that can't be beat!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in June after visiting Rocky Mountain National Park. We had our dog with us and this Best Western had pet rooms. I have stayed in many Best Western hotels in the West and Pacific Northwest. This is by far one of the cleanist Best Western or any hotel I have stayed in. The bed was very comfortable. There is no airconditioning but your at 9,200 ft, so you want need it anyway. We did not hear any outside noise at night. The breakfast was more than basic and was good. The breakfast area is very small, so I would plan to eat in the room if the hotel is crowded. The lake is an easy walk from the hotel and has nice mountain views. There is a path that goes around the lake. This is a good stopping point if you are headed West or South in CO. We had left a personal pillow and the hotel sent it back to us. Vail, CO and the Top of the Rockies scenic byway are a short drive from this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice weekend getaway

reviews.text: While travelling to the Dillon/Silverthorne area for a set of meetings we stayed at the Ptarmigan Lodge. The hotel is conveniently located about 10 minutes down the mountain from Keystone, 15 minutes from A-Basin. It is also relatively close to several restaurants and bars. So while not slopeside by any means it really does fall in a location that is accesible to the area. Of particular note is the Arapahoe Cafe next door that puts together an AMAZING breakfast. The hotel is clean and well-maintained although a bit dated with its fixturing. There is no workout room and the witeless internet access, while free, is pretty slow. There is evidently a gym in town somewhere that you can pay an additional $9/day to utilize although I didn't have the opportunity to check that out. The price for this hotel in this area can't be beat at about half of what you'd pay a few minutes further up the hill. If I were to return to the area I would stay again and would probably recommend to friends looking to stay on a budget.
reviews.title: A decent place to put your head down.

reviews.text: Stayed one night on a ski weekend. Hotel was full. Our room had an old "motor hotel" design, but it was clean and nicely finished with newer bathroom tile and granite counters. We stayed in the building attached to the front office (facing the lake), which had outside hallways. Wi-fi was not available in our room, but we didn't follow up since it was not needed during this short stay. Good prices relative to other local lodging. The breakfast included hot eggs and sausage along with standard continental breakfast offerings.
reviews.title: Good value for location, clean room and breakfast

reviews.text: My husband and I come to Colorado at least 3 times a year with our kids and have stayed at this hotel for the last 3-4 years and love it. The place is located across the street from Lake Dillon and a small outdoor amphiteater, which holds concerts in the summer. During the winter you can walk on the frozen lake and around it. It is located on a side street but walking distance to a shopping center and a movie theater (less than a mile). The employees and management go out of their way to make your stay as memorable and comfortable as possible. From bringing an extra towel to locating a specific store, they are wonderful and very friendly people. The rooms are good size, very clean and warm and the beds are comfortable. The snow on the parking lot is plowed even before you wake up. The breakfast has a good variety of pastries, cereal, eggs and sausage, included in the price. There is also a restaurant with a more hearty menu. It is a quiet place and close to the skiing areas. I would wholehartedly recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: Love it

reviews.text: I ignored the bad reviews on trip advisor. Bad idea. The room smelled terrible, but I didn't want to go search for another room that night. Finally I went to the desk to talk to them about it. The desk clerk was very rude and indifferent, informed me the room had been cleaned that morning, and refused to go check it out herself (twenty feet, max, from the desk-). When I informed her I was leaving, she would not refund all my money and charged me $20! Great view, but the staff could care less about your comfort. stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: stay elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a short hiking vacation. The room we stayed in was more than adequate. I would suggest that if you can request a room in Building 3 or 4, do so. Building 2 looks very dated with doors facing the outside. The Hot Tub/Spa was awesome...a 10 seater, nice and hot, along with a nice, roomy sauna. The trail alongside Lake Dillon is right there...you can hike to Frisco (a real hike) or down to Silverthorne (not so bad). There is nothing fancy about the Ptarmigan Lodge, but it is clean and the front desk staff was very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Value, great location
